title: When will Telegram’s digital currency, Gram, launch for the public?
preds: Highly unlikely it will be released today, the last day.

Digital currencies are not deemed securities by the SEC, but tokens are. It is highly unlikely, however, that Telegram will ever actually attempt to issue a cryptocurrency.
https://cointelegraph.com/news/sec-vs-telegram-part-1-key-takeaways-for-now

They got caught up in the crackdown on cryptocurrency and the FTC is making them an example. No chance they'll launch until the legal barrage stops, and that isn't likely to happen for the next few years. This question should be reposted to ask "before 1 October 2022".
Telegram was recently hacked. Tangential to this question aside from issue of trust.

With the upcoming presidential election I don't foresee Telegraph making an announcement until after they know who will be in the White House and what kind of regulatory scene they will have to work with.

From May: "After years of drama with the SEC, Telegram is calling it quits on its crypto-focused subsidiary, Telegram Open Network (TON) ... Last October, the SEC ordered Telegram to halt sales of its cryptocurrency (called Gram) after it failed to register an early sale of $1.7 billion in tokens prior to launching the network. " https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/12/21256407/telegram-cryptocurrency-shutdown-sec-gram

Successful launch of a speculative asset such as digital currency requires generally bullish risk markets. In digital currencies’ case, some speculation around future path of inflation and devaluation of fiat currencies would also help. Neither of those are likely to be there in the short term.
Too much legal uncertainty and troubles in US courts.
Digital currency is complex and will need more time
Currently predicted by end of October.

Project cancelled - due to US prohibiting global distribution [1]. All sources reporting cancellation [2] as of 25th May 2020.  "After months of litigation concerning the distribution of Telegram’s Gram digital currency, the company announced that it is ending its Telegram Open Network blockchain project (TON) and the Gram token at the heart of the controversy." [1] - https://news.bitcoin.com/telegram-ton-cryptocurrency/
[2] - https://coingeek.com/telegram-abandons-gram-token-what-does-it-signal-for-future-of-coin-offerings/
It won't happen [1]. I've asked for the resolution of the question. [1] https://telegra.ph/What-Was-TON-And-Why-It-Is-Over-05-12
I guess never should be the correct option now (or should it?). Not happening before 1 Oct for sure now!

The Telegram, TON and GRAM mess is not going to be resolved soon. Telegram had done an ICO (Initial Coin Offering) and raised around USD 1.7 Billion with the future sale of its GRAM tokens. The ICO was done in early to mid 2018. The tokens were to be delivered sometime last year (2019). The SEC filed a complaint against Telegram in the Southern District of NY in Oct 2019. The detailed timeline of that case can be found here - https://dockets.justia.com/docket/new-york/nysdce/1:2019cv09439/524448 The court issued an injunction asking Telegram to stop and planned issuance of the GRAM token in March 2020 - https://www.coindesk.com/judge-halts-telegram-token-issuance-in-injunction-requested-by-sec Telegram (and the Blockchain Association) is appealing this in the US Court of Appeals for the 2nd Circuit (https://www.ca2.uscourts.gov/). Details of the appeal can be found here - https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xXq6Y-_zhlSrr76c9bhIyLtG1_r_QXqk/view Given the current schedule at the CA2, and the general complexities of the case - chances of the GRAM token being released before 1st Oct 2020 (5 months) seem slim. So,
between 1 May and 30 Sep -    2%
Not before 1st Oct                -  98%

Doesn't look like it is going to happen any time soon since "a preliminary injunction preventing Telegram’s distribution of its Gram tokens for the foreseeable future" was issued [1]. [1] https://www.natlawreview.com/article/bitblog-bi-weekly-update-april-21-2020
I don't think they will do it.

Sec trouble for keybase: lower

Earn it might divert focus to encryption stuff

A principios de octubre del año pasado la comisión de seguridad e intercambio (SEC) de Estados Unidos presentó una demanda contra la aplicación telegram responsable de la creación y emisión de TON (Telegram open network) y su criptomoneda nativa, Gram tokens, lo que generó el aplazamiento del lanzamiento de esta de Octubre 2019 a Abril 2020. 
La actual fecha de lanzamiento es el 30 de abril, sin embargo, uno de los inversores que habló con el equipo encargado de TON, afirmó que es bastante improbable que esto alcancen la fecha límite.
"Votamos por esperar, aunque estamos seguros de que Telegram no podrá aclarar las cosas con la SEC", dijo uno de los inversores de TON a CoinDesk bajo condición de anonimato.
Tomando como supuesto que los problemas existentes entre Telegram y la SEC son demasiado complejos y tomarán varios meses en resolverse, mi predicción es, con un 90%, que  la opción más probable es que TON no se lanzará antes de Octubre 2020. Siguiéndole con un 8% está la opción de que sea lanzada entre mayo y septiembre 2020, y ya con 2% que la aplicación salga antes de mayo 2020, ya que estando a mitades de abril y sin tener mayor información o avances en los acuerdos realizados con la SEC, es posible asumir que es realmente improbable que TON sea lanzado antes de esta fecha. Fuentes:

- https://www.financemagnates.com/cryptocurrency/news/sec-vs-telegram-will-gram-tokens-ever-be-distributed/

Nice summary from @sebawi -  Some notes from another article which support a delayed opening (https://www.financemagnates.com/cryptocurrency/news/sec-vs-telegram-will-gram-tokens-ever-be-distributed/) 
-- "In any case, the SEC’s crackdown on Telegram for using this SAFT structure will likely set an important precedent for other projects that may attempt to pull similar stunts.
-- “The whole model of a SAFT is challenged and might cease to exist,” wrote Anatoliy Knyazev, executive director and co-founder of cryptocurrency trading platform Exante, in an email to Finance Magnates.
- The outcome of the Telegram case, along with additional cases in the future, will help to determine what kinds of patterns are forming in the SEC’s behavior: “upcoming promising US-based blockchain projects like Near Protocol will look at this closely,” Ohtamaa said. With potential precedent setting implications - it is likely arguments will take some time to resolve within the courts.  The counter-argument is related to a similar case that was resolved by Block.one back in January of 2019.  The company paid a relatively small fine ($24million).  The question remains whether or not Telegram will take a cooperative approach or remain somewhat combative with the SEC.  A refusal to service an SEC subpoena which resulted in the SEC lawsuit does not seem to point toward cooperation.

Deleted my full response by accident, so here is the short summary. I follow [1, 2] in the assumption that there won't be a launch of Gram in the near future. Three key elements determining launch: 1. Technical implemenation (seems to be less of a problem, if we consider the initial launch date)
2. Market access (Telegram does not convey the impression that they'll release Gram without legal approvement in key markets such as the US - see the recent actions to clarify information around Gram and the publication of bank records => no legal approvement in major markets, no launch - in particular understandable considering the investors)
3. SEC lawsuit (major issue, it does not look good for Telegram => long legal battle likely)
4. Other issues (such as security and fulfillment of contract details) [1] https://davidgerard.co.uk/blockchain/2018/12/29/the-telegram-icos-ton-blockchain-has-questionable-security-and-will-probably-centralise/
[2] https://davidgerard.co.uk/blockchain/2020/01/11/telegram-tries-to-appease-the-sec-no-grams-in-messenger/
I see a mini bull market happening April/May which will pump liquidity into the overall market followed by consolidation, creating a potentially healthier outlook.
After more review I see SEC suit and legal wrangling. Could such a system rival Swift? US would not want that. Key is Telegram’s depositions in January. More review later.

When will Telegram’s digital currency, Gram, launch for the public?
Keep it simple, don't over think this one.
A launch will be attempted by the summer, otherwise it never will
No indications it will be any time soon.
Most governments Anti digital currency given reduced control/influence.
Value is jointly determined peer to peer. pegging its value to a commodity only works as long as whales need to support the value of their own holdings.
Too dangerous for the US to allow Gram to be launched taking into account 200+ mln subscribers of Telegram and no control over the currency from any government.
Lot of negative press regarding digital currency and issue with Facebooks Libra means there is nervousness.

Reasons for early launch:
1. Expeditious court ruling in favor of TON
2. Out of court settlement with SEC
3. TON may launch worldwide except in US Reasons for delay:
1. Lack of precedents in such cases and the need for court and SEC to understand the issues related to new technology such as crypto-currency.
2. A protracted legal battle 
3. Planing fallacy - 6 months delay could easily creep to more than a year in case of disputes with government agencies

Evidence in favor of earlier release date:
1 - Telegram seems like a highly successful company Evidence in favor of a late release date:
1 - Wisdom of the crowd
2 - some 45% of product launches are delayed by 1+ months
3 - FB botched its own attempt
4 - I haven't seen much on this and imagine Telegram would want to publicize it more if they were releasing soon

Telegram may be able to technically deliver the keys. But, they aren't going to do that without being able to get the money. What are the odds that BNY Mellon and Credit Suisse are going to deliver those payments in light of the SEC calling them "unregistered securities"? The chance they jeopardize their business for Grams is nil. Leaving in a slight hedge just in case I missed something here. "Telegram told investors it was using Wall Street megabanks BNY Mellon and Credit Suisse to move and store fiat currency raised in last year’s blockchain token sale, court filings show...During one such chat, Telegram employee Shyam Parekh explained to an investor how the funds were supposed to reach the company...“We will receive the funds through BNY, which will forward the funds to CS (Schweiz) AG for final credit to Credit Suisse AG,” Parekh wrote, providing the international bank code for wiring money to Credit Suisse via the Swift network...The court will hear the SEC and Telegram discuss whether gram is an unregistered security on Feb. 18-19."[1] [1] https://finance.yahoo.com/news/telegram-investor-documents-bny-mellon-220006732.html

Due to the nature of rolling out new technology, and how dates are generally fluxing as new tech is verified for public consumption, I believe the likelihood of launching at it's initial date is relatively substantive but less so than pushing back another few months due to bugs and/or backend work required.
Comparison class: Facebook's attempts at cryptocurrency. https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-wanted-to-create-a-new-currency-it-wasnt-ready-for-the-backlash-11571242795

SEC is calling it an unregistered security and is trying to depose Hyman. If they do it, Hyman will likely spend some time in jail. "The SEC asked the U.S. court to issue a Letter of Request to the Senior Master of the High Court (Queen’s Bench Division) of England and Wales, requesting the deposition of Hyman, a UK citizen who is currently residing there, the filing says. The procedure is possible thanks to the Hague Convention, which allows courts to seek evidence and testimonies beyond their own jurisdictions, the filing says." https://www.coindesk.com/sec-reveals-telegrams-communications-with-investors-seeks-to-question-advisor
